questions.question: What is the kinetic diameter of C2H4 as mentioned in the text?
Which material has been identified as an ideal molecular sieve for C2H2/C2H4 separation?
What is the pore size of UTSA-200a, and how does it compare to the kinetic diameter of C2H2?
questions.answer: The pore size of UTSA-200a is 3.4 Å, which is slightly larger than the kinetic diameter of C2H2 (3.3 Å).

questions.question: True or False: The presence of CO2 significantly affects the separation capacity of UTSA-200a.
What is the C2H2 uptake capacity of UTSA-200a from a 1/99 C2H2/C2H4 mixture at 0.01 bar?
How does the C2H4 uptake of UTSA-200a compare to SIFSIX-2-Cu-i at pressures up to 0.7 bar?
questions.answer: The C2H4 uptake of UTSA-200a is dramatically lower than that of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i at pressures up to 0.7 bar.

questions.question: True or False: UTSA-200a exhibits the highest C2H2 uptake at 0.01 bar when compared to other materials mentioned.
What is the purity of C2H4 produced using UTSA-200a in the experimental breakthrough curves?
True or False: The framework of UTSA-200a remains stable after multiple adsorption and breakthrough experiments.
What is the primary factor for the ultrahigh C2H2 adsorption capacity of UTSA-200a at very low pressures?
questions.answer: The primary factor is the strong interactions with C2H2 molecules, indicated by the shorter H-bonding length in UTSA-200a compared to SIFSIX-2-Cu-i.

questions.question: True or False: The presence of moisture significantly degrades the performance of UTSA-200a in separating C2H2 from C2H4.
What is the recovery percentage of C2H2 capacity per cycle for UTSA-200a?
True or False: UTSA-200a exhibits a molecular sieving effect for C3H6/C3H8 separation.
What is the IAST selectivity of UTSA-200a for binary C2H2/C2H4 (1/99, v/v) mixtures at 1 bar and 298 K?
True or False: The adsorption-induced lattice distortion in UTSA-200a is a permanent effect.
What is the effect of using a shorter organic linker in the construction of SIFSIX-14-Cu-i compared to SIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
questions.answer: The use of a shorter organic linker in SIFSIX-14-Cu-i results in a commensurate reduction in the pore size and a certain degree of tilting of the pyridine moieties.

questions.question: True or False: The C2H2/C2H4 selectivity of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i precludes coadsorption of the larger molecule, C2H4, when C2H2 is a minor impurity.
What is the role of the SiF6 2− binding sites in UTSA-200a?
questions.answer: The SiF6 2− binding sites in UTSA-200a are functionalized with strong interactions toward C2H2 molecules, contributing to its high C2H2 adsorption capacity.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms of UTSA-200a for CO2 at 196 K and N2 at 77 K indicate that N2 is not blocked by the material.
What is the significance of the molecular sieving dimension of 3.4 Å in UTSA-200a?
questions.answer: The molecular sieving dimension of 3.4 Å in UTSA-200a is significant because it is much smaller than the kinetic diameter of C2H4 molecule (4.2 Å) but slightly larger than that of C2H2 (3.3 Å), enabling selective molecular sieving in C2H2/C2H4 separations.
